content.description:
Thin flakes on slab with a steep finish

Right end of wall between Fallen Flake and Sweet Caroline
4 bolts to a two bolt anchor

* Submitted by Alex Weber **

Starts the same as One Move Wonder, and heads right. Mostly slab.

Same start as 'One Move Wonder', over the lip down low.
4 bolts, top anchors.

Climbs thin slab to juggy vertical rock right of Sweet Caroline. Short but quality. This route was home to an old orphaned bolt, so some partial credit may belong to another unknown developer.

Right of sweet Caroline at the far right end of the wall.
3 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.

* Submitted by Alex Weber ** 
 Stick clip the first bolt, it's rather high up. Fun climb with thought-provoking moves. Crimps and balance and slab climbing will get you to the top.

4 bolts, anchors at top.

* Submitted by Alex Weber ** 
 This route is just left of a very large crack in the wall. I can't remember, but you may use the crack at the beginning of the climb. About halfway or three-quarters of the way up you will be standing on this slabby wave feature, and have no idea how to move up. And you'll ask yourself 'this is a 5.8?' Balance your way left and find some holds and go up.

This route is just left of a very large crack in the wall.
4 bolts, top anchors.

* Submitted by Alex Weber ** 
 The first move is tough if you don't know the beta. Clip the only bolt (which is also the first bolt for the 5.8 route to that heads right), and head up the crack to your left. This crack takes some good gear. After the crack you head left onto a balancey position and want to place gear... but beats me. Head right and up onto some easy slab to the anchors.

The start is the same as 'Alternative Finish'. Find the first bolt over the lip low down.
1 bolt at the bottom, then a crack that takes good gear. After the crack I can't find any more gear placements, so you're run-out from there to the end (about 3/4 of the way up, plus it's easy climbing after the crack). Top anchors.

Great climb! A must do if you're in the area. The beginning is tough and reachy. Pull hard on with your left hand the side pull you can barely reach, put a right foot on a polished and barely-there foot hold and pop up to a good hold. Put your right foot somewhere, change your left to a heel hook, and go up to the solid side-pull/undercling. Clip. Move up the side pull, clipping, and reach a good chock ledge. Next is the crux: move up to some reachy horizontal pockets, and move over the lip. Now you have a roof to pull, but it is nothing compare to what you just did :)

Second route from the trail.
5 bolts, top anchors.

* Submitted by Alex Weber ** 
 Crazy fun 5.10a climb. Just make your way from ledge to ledge: hop, jump, campus, whatever. Sweet ledges all the way to the roof. When you get to the roof, use some underclings and side-pulls then reach up over the lip to some really good ledge holds. Pull yourself over.

Last route at Back Alley.
4 bolts, top anchors.

This route is a lot of fun. Head up the left side pull and balance yourself while desperately trying to find a god damn foot hold. Eventually you will get up to what gives this route it's name: a sweet hole. Shove a couple digits in here, and haul for all you're worth, then convert to a undercling and continue to haul. You'll reach some good holds and move up and arete. Not tough at this point, but you may be too pumped to finish it off.

This route is the first bolted route you will see, and is far from the other routes. It's rather short, and you have to scramble up to a ledge to reach the beginning.
5 bolts, top anchors.

climbs.name: Vandalism Deception
climbs.fa: Mike Lewis and Alain Dallaire - Fall 2009

content.description:
* Submitted by Alex Weber ** 
 This climb is seriously awful. My vote for worst climb in the Yukon.  
 Starts with a funny mantle. Maybe you crawl into the chimney... but the first bolt is way out left... so that doesn't make much sense.  
 Ok fine. You're standing on a good ledge and clip the first bolt. Second bolt is just above. Not too bad to get there, but where do you go now? The third bolt is straight up, and run-out. You can head left on some small features... or straight up on very difficult moves... but either way, you risk falling quite a ways down.  
 Or you head far right, into the chimney. Why?! From here it's pretty easy to get to the third bolt. Finishing is also tricky. How was this originally rated a 5.8?

4 bolts. Two expansion bolt top anchors. One has a d-link. The other does not.

Back Alley, which is located on our beloved Grey Mountain, has some excellent 5.10 sport climbs and some interesting 5.8s as well. This area can be horrendously buggy in the summer. It is a nice place to go later in the season when it's a bit colder and the bugs don't come out. Doesn't get much activity, so it's nice and quiet. The rock is nice limestone and the non-5.10 climbs are pretty slabby.
